DataElement.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Right Common Iliac Artery Involvement Node Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric count regarding the sentinel lymph node biopsy from the right common iliac artery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Right Common Iliac Artery Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. Cancer cells may appear first in the sentinel node before spreading to other lymph nodes._Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north._An artery arising from the bifurcation of the abdominal aorta which then bifurcates forming the internal and external iliac arteries._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. Cancer cells may appear first in the sentinel node before spreading to other lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: The first lymph node that is affected by cancer spread from the primary site.  Sentinel lymph node biopsy is part of the staging work-up to determine early metastasis to regional lymph nodes in patients with breast carcinoma or melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.:No Value Exists:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
An artery arising from the bifurcation of the abdominal aorta which then bifurcates forming the internal and external iliac arteries.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information related to the numeric count of lymph nodes.
